intro: Euphrasia coronata, commonly known as the crowned eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem. Euphrasia coronata is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
